wikipedia_page.main: William  Issacher Garfield Kingdon (25 June 1907 – 18 March 1977) was an English footballer who played, as a wing-half, over 240 games for Aston Villa. Towards the end of his career, he joined Southampton, before becoming a manager in lower-league football.

response: * Longest Serving Manager: Billy Kingdon, 8 years (1938–46)
